title: A Special Heart from King Henry VIII's Time
summary: The British Museum in London has raised enough money to keep a special gold pendant called the Tudor Heart. This pendant is linked to King Henry VIII and his first wife, Katherine of Aragon. It was found by a person using a metal detector in a field in Warwickshire in 2019. The museum needed £3.5 million to buy it and put it on display forever. Many people helped by donating money, including over 45,000 members of the public. The pendant has symbols like a Tudor rose and a pomegranate, and it might have been made for a royal wedding celebration long ago. Now, everyone can see it at the museum and learn about history.

background_read: King Henry VIII was a king of England who lived from 1491 to 1547. He is famous for having six wives and for starting the Church of England. Katherine of Aragon was his first wife, and they were married for many years. The Tudor period was a time in English history when the Tudor family ruled, and it included kings and queens like Henry VIII and Elizabeth I. Museums like the British Museum collect old objects to help people learn about history and see things from the past.
